bioghist.p: The Geneva Forum was an organization for laity and clergy of the Presbytery of Philadelphia to provide a place for open discussion of issues facing the church within an evangelical context. Formed in 1971 during a period of "cleavage between liberals and evangelicals," the Geneva Forum was spawned from the Geneva Cleric, a group of ministers who met monthly for prayer and fellowship. Once the Geneva Forum was formed, the officers of the Geneva Cleric continued as the leaders of the Forum. The Forum was formally disbanded around 1997.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains minutes of the Geneva Forum, primarily from 1983-1994; meeting announcements and flyers; banquet programs; by-laws; notes on officer duties; lists of board members and officers; meeting agendas; list of programs and speakers; and biographical information on speakers. There are also manuscript notes and handouts from meetings and correspondence, largely of invitations to speakers and logistical matters for meetings. Many of the papers in this collection appear to come from the files of Paul E. Housworth and Robert Bruce Wills.
